definition[0]: the percentage amount charged by a bank etc when you borrow money, or paid to you by a bank when you keep money in an account there
definition[1]: the percentage rate used for calculating interest over a particular period of time, usually one year
example[0]: The credit card has an interest rate of 14.8%.
example[1]: The fear of higher interest rates is driving down the stockmarket.
example[2]: The fall in interest rates should lead to additional business investment.
